title: SHA-256 Algorithm
description: Master the SHA-256 hash function, part of the SHA-2 family, which remains one of the most widely used and secure cryptographic hash functions.

sections.subtitle: Overview and Context
sections.description: SHA-256 is part of the SHA-2 family, designed by the NSA and published by NIST in 2001.
points: Widely used in modern security applications
No practical attacks known to date

sections.subtitle: Technical Specifications
sections.description: Core specifications that define SHA-256's structure.

sections.subtitle: Initialization Values
sections.description: SHA-256 uses specific initial hash values derived from prime numbers.
points: Eight initial hash values (h0 to h7)
64 round constants based on cube roots
sections.codeExample:
# Initial hash values (first 32 bits of fractional parts of square roots of first 8 primes)
h0 = 0x6a09e667
h1 = 0xbb67ae85
h2 = 0x3c6ef372
h3 = 0xa54ff53a
h4 = 0x510e527f
h5 = 0x9b05688c
h6 = 0x1f83d9ab
h7 = 0x5be0cd19

sections.subtitle: Round Processing
sections.codeExample:
def sha256_round(a, b, c, d, e, f, g, h, k, w):
    ch = (e & f) ^ (~e & g)
    maj = (a & b) ^ (a & c) ^ (b & c)
    s0 = rotate_right(a, 2) ^ rotate_right(a, 13) ^ rotate_right(a, 22)
    s1 = rotate_right(e, 6) ^ rotate_right(e, 11) ^ rotate_right(e, 25)
    temp1 = h + s1 + ch + k + w
    temp2 = s0 + maj
    return (temp1 + temp2) & 0xffffffff, a, b, c, (d + temp1) & 0xffffffff, e, f, g

questions.question: What is the output size of SHA-256?
questions.explanation: SHA-256 produces a 256-bit (32-byte) hash value, providing strong security against collision and preimage attacks.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a primary application of SHA-256?
questions.explanation: While SHA-256 is cryptographically secure, it should not be used alone for password storage. Password hashing requires specialized algorithms like bcrypt or Argon2.

questions.question: How many rounds does SHA-256 use in its compression function?
questions.explanation: SHA-256 uses 64 rounds in its compression function, providing a good balance between security and performance.
